definition: to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
(negative prefix)/not/no
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: At this moment, we should not panic, you have to have a tranquil quiet of mind.
sentences.chinese: 此時此刻，要處變不驚，就得有一份安謐寧靜的心態。

sentences.english: Many years of performance experience develop a panic personality, a highly compressive.
sentences.chinese: 多年的演出經驗養成了處變不驚的個性，抗壓性極強。

sentences.english: Who in your organization is unflappable amid change?
sentences.chinese: 你公司裏最處變不驚的人是誰？

definition: calm/unruffled
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to turn a blind eye to

to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
equestrianism/horsemanship

lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
